The Tri-Slosher Nouveau is nearly identical in appearance to the Tri-Slosher. The only difference between the two is that the Tri-Slosher Nouveau has a sticker bearing the Nouveau logo on the side of the bucket.

In Splatoon 3, the bucket itself is based on its base variant's redesign, and the handle is light blue.

The Tri-Slosher Nouveau was released on 19 December 2015 at  02:00 UTC.[1] It comes with Seekers and the Echolocator.

- Each attack consumes 6% of the ink tank capacity.
This allows players to attack 16 times before needing to refill the ink supply.

Combined with the main weapon, the time-delayed explosions of the Splat Bombs allow for maximum ink coverage!

The Tri-Slosher Nouveau returns in Splatoon 3. It functions the same as the normal Tri-Slosher, but has a different kit and appearance. It has a Nouveau sticker on the side and a light blue handle rather than the traditional yellow one. The kit is Fizzy Bomb and Tacticooler. The weapon was teased in the Fresh Season 2023 poster shown on 16 February 2023 and was officially revealed on 23 February 2023. It released on 28 February 2023.

The Tri-Slosher Nouveau is a special version of the Tri-Slosher that includes an exclusive sticker! And if the sticker isn't selling it, let me tell you about the loadout... First up, you get Fizzy Bombs, enabling you to close the distance between you and your opponents quickly. If you've used sloshers before, you already know that close equals splat! And you can amp up the mobility even more with the Tacticooler! Now you're gliding around the map like a manta ray with rocket boosters, and your teammates are getting a boost too. Don't even get me started on the ink coverage. It's also great! So I hope you give this set a try. It can really turn the tide in battle!

- Early datamining of Splatoon 2 showed that the Tri-Slosher Nouveau was meant to have Autobomb Launcher as its special, and the icon for this special was also found. The data miners even recorded footage of it in action on the test range. However, it was later changed to have the Ink Storm, and the Autobomb Launcher was instead released with the Carbon Roller Deco and Light Tetra Dualies.

Tri-Slosher Nouveau is derived from the verb to slosh, Tri, a shortening meaning Three, and Nouveau, french for New. Nouveau may also refer to Art Nouveau. The suffix Nouveau is also used to differentiate it from the Tri-Slosher. This trait is shared among the other alternate sets of the Nouveau brand.

ヒッセン・ヒュー Hissen Hyū means Brush Washer Hue. 筆洗 Hissen are segmented buckets that are used for cleaning paintbrushes. ヒュー Hyū refers to hue. Like Nouveau in the English name, Hue is used to differentiate it from the Tri-Slosher.
